data.title: preys and predators
data.statement:
You're a scientist observing the life cycle of a simple ecosystem composed of rabbits and foxes.
You observed that  these populations are pretty predictable : 
* after each month, if the rabbit population was over 12 times the fox population, each fox eats three rabbits, then the fox population increases by 20%; otherwise, each fox eats one rabbit, and the fox population decreases by 10%  (keep only the integer part)
* after each month, if the temperature ranges between 20 and 35ยบ included, the remaining rabbit population doubles; otherwise, it decreases by 10% (keep only the integer part)


You are given the number of rabbits and foxes at some point and the temperatures for the n following months.

How many rabbits and foxes will be remaining after n months?
data.stubGenerator:
read rabbits:int foxes:int n:int
loopline n temperature:int
write rabbits foxes
data.inputDescription:
<<line 1>> : 3 integers: [[rabbits]], [[foxes]] representing the number of rabbits and foxes at month 0  and [[n]] the month at which you want to predict the number of  remaining rabbits and foxes
<<line 2>> : [[n]] integers representing the temperatures at month 0 to [[n]]-1
data.outputDescription: two integers representing the number of live rabbits and foxes at month [[n]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You're a scientist observing the life cycle of a simple ecosystem composed of rabbits and foxes.
You observed that these populations are pretty predictable :
* after each month, if the rabbit population was over 12 times the fox population, each fox eats three rabbits, then the fox population increases by 20%; otherwise, each fox eats one rabbit, and the fox population decreases by 10% (keep only the integer part)
* after each month, if the temperature ranges between 20 and 35º included, the remaining rabbit population doubles; otherwise, it decreases by 10% (keep only the integer part)


You are given the number of rabbits and foxes at some point and the temperatures for the n following months.

How many rabbits and foxes will be remaining after n months?
Input
line 1 : 3 integers: rabbits, foxes representing the number of rabbits and foxes at month 0 and n the month at which you want to predict the number of remaining rabbits and foxes
line 2 : n integers representing the temperatures at month 0 to n-1
Output
two integers representing the number of live rabbits and foxes at month n
Constraints
rabbits >= 0
foxes >= 0
n >= 1
Example
Input
1000 100 1
5
Output
810 90
